intro: Astragalus tragacanthoides, commonly known as the Persian milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, sticky resin that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. Its ability to thrive in harsh environments makes it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
